page.title: 13Tetchill Jubilee Celebration
page.content: Probably the biggest event that has happened recently and certainly one that we remember with affection was the Queen's Silver Jubilee in 1977. This was an occasion when the whole community got together and lots of people worked very hard to make it a great success. A committee organised fund raising activities over the preceding year and the actual'do' took place at Winston Farm. A fun sports meet was held in the afternoon with events ranging from "wellie wanging" to running. A tea was organised in one of Mr.Sinker's barns,and,after it each child was given a special jubilee crown (25p. piece).A quantity of real ale was bought from the Three Tuns at Bishop's Castle with lemonade, sherry etc. for those who did not like the beer.The evening was spent in English folk dancing with a local band.
